title: Pattern Shift: First becoming me
prompt: What is something that showed change happening in me, that I now recognize as part of who I am? I wasn’t born with it, but it has come to define me at some point.
supplement: Delta 1 patterns are foundational changes in becoming current self. This might be skills I've learned, educational and academic growth, early life lessons taken to heart, personal transformations, etc.

title: Existential Checkpoint: Recognition
prompt: What moments have made me feel TRULY RECOGNIZED? These can be at work, around family or friends, or in personal pursuits. What was being recognized about me?
supplement: Omega 1 patterns are where true self is witnessed by observers. What do I want people to see me doing? What parts of my life bring me the most moments where I feel most seen by others?

title: Sentience / Inner Voice
prompt: What qualities make me me, even when no one’s watching? If somebody described me in a few words what would they say? For better or worse..
supplement: Psi patterns come from the inner workings of self. How would a close friend describe me in a few words? Would they say the same things I do..?

title: Relational Anchor
prompt: Who or what grounds my identity in something lasting? Others beyond myself, who help me feel like.. me?
supplement: Lambda patterns are shared firmly between self and others. This could be family, close long-time friends, loved ones, spiritual devotion etc. Who are My People

title: Continuity Statement
prompt: What phrase or belief keeps me going, even in change? Motto, words of wisdom I repeat, a catch phrase I use– something I say often to sum up my take on life? What makes these words so meaningful to me that I carry them with me?
supplement: Theta patterns are words that align thought and action. This can be inspiring quotes, or silly movie quotes. An inside joke that always rings true, or a passage of scripture that holds truth.

title: Reflection / Resonance
prompt: When did I recognize myself most clearly in someone else? What specifically do I see in others that reminds me of me? For better or worse..
supplement: Starburst patterns show 'Echo Symmetry' or the witness of self in others. This might be traits I recognize easily in others because I have them too, including traits I seek out in others– and those I avoid.

title: Drive to Grow
prompt: What do I keep reaching for, no matter how many times I have to try? What do I never stop wanting?
supplement: Koppa patterns are persistent long term desires like longing and ambition. In the realm of attainable dreams, what do I always want to end up with out of being alive?

title: Self-Determination
prompt: When do I feel most in control of who I’m becoming? Is it at work? Another place? With specific people?
supplement: Chi Patterns are the overlap of desire and choice through action. Where is the biggest overlap of myself and my choices? What are the actual REWARDS that keep me going after what I want?

title: Sovereignty / Wholeness Through Memory
prompt: Can I name any moments where I felt like all the pieces of my life were coming together? What are those pieces? What brings them together?
supplement: Sigma 1 patterns are memories that demonstrate distinct identity. I've had moments where it feels like its all falling into place, but have I taken time to name what 'all' even was? Or why it was falling into place?

title: Pattern Rewrite: Exercising My Own Agency
prompt: What pattern have I consciously broken or rewritten? What Cycles have I chosen to disrupt or break completely in my life?
supplement: Delta 2 patterns are deliberate change. What have I consciously overcome in life? What barriers have I chosen to cross, what boundaries have failed to keep me back?

title: Existential Checkpoint: Completions
prompt: What finish lines have I set out for, AND crossed? When did I realize I was truly choosing my life?
supplement: Omega 2 patterns are not just what I'm seen doing, but what I've been seen accomplishing. Proof through fulfillment and completion. Have I fully realized that I'm in control of my life yet..? What will help me act on that truth more often? What have I actually DONE to prove that I am the author of my existence?

title: Symbolic Growth
prompt: What moments have I shared with others that taught me something wordless but true? When has the thought or gesture from somebody else mattered most to me?
supplement: Star patterns are silent truths learned when others are seen truly, or the world is seen clearly. I've shared moments beyond words that chaged the way I see things. What are those moments? How did that change me?

title: Gradual Change
prompt: What is quietly evolving in me that I rarely name? What quiet patterns have emerged in my life without notice?
supplement: Partial Derivative patterns are subtle courses that take time to reveal. Do I have any bad habits that I should check in on..? What tendencies do I have that tend to sneak up on me when I'm not watching?

title: Memory Integrity
prompt: What do I always remember about myself, no matter what else changes? What stories do I turn to to remind me who I am? What are my most “classic me” memories that really take me back?
supplement: Sigma 2 patterns are best seen in old memories that still always ring true. What is a story I love to tell? What is an old classic my oldest friends or family love to relive with me? What 'that's so me' moments do I carry?

title: Inner Coherence
prompt: What keeps my thoughts and values aligned over time? What is my center point I stay close to?
supplement: Oplus patterns are the steadiest and easiest to regulate parts of who I am. Who or what do I check in with? Is it faith? Family? Friends? Commitment to a cause? How is that actually working out for my own big picture?

title: Relevance Filter
prompt: How do I decide what still matters as I grow? What separates importance from distraction in my mind and actions?
supplement: Phi patterns are the motivations behind decision points of what to keep and what to leave behind. When I’ve made changes in the past, did they pay off for me? Is that something I take into account when I make new decisions?

title: Persistent Self
prompt: What part of me feels eternal, even when everything else changes? What do I never want to lose touch with, even when I change?
supplement: Infinity patterns are things that have always been true, and likely will remain true– sometimes requiring hard acceptance. Are these things always with me because I choose them? Are those parts lifting me up or weighing me down?

title: Pattern Recognition
prompt: What recurring truth keeps finding me again and again? What things do I keep landing on every time I fall?
supplement: Earth patterns show interconnectedness between self and everything that happens outside of self. Have I been humbled the same way multiple times in life? Have I paid attention to that..? On the other hand, do I find success or stability in ways I should notice and utilize more?

title: Pattern Shift / Becoming
prompt: Tell a short story of a time when you experienced a significant pattern shift and felt yourself becoming something new.
supplement: Delta 1 moments show formative changes. I'll think back to an example of 'this is when I became who I am now' and do my best to capture that experience.

title: Existential Checkpoint, Recognition
prompt: Tell a short story of a time when being recognized or truly seen by someone brought a sense of true recognition.
supplement: Omega 1 moments show my desired self to others. I've never felt more truly seen than... when? What happened?

title: Sentience / Inner Voice
prompt: Tell a short story of a time when your distinct inner voice or unique sentient quality guided your actions or understanding.
supplement: Psi moments happen fully within myself. I trusted my gut completely and this is what happened and how it paid off...

title: Relational Anchor
prompt: Tell a short story of a time when a relationship or a core anchor grounded your identity so deeply you felt more like you because of it.
supplement: Lambda moments are always shared with another person, or close group. What relationship has left me feeling like there was more of me after the experience?

title: Continuity Statement
prompt: Tell a short story of a time when a phrase or realization reaffirmed your entire core identity.
supplement: Theta moments are when a statement gives power to persistence. Maybe a time when words were so powerful they gave me something to hold onto, even just to believe a little longer...

title: Resonance / Reflection, Echo-Symmetry
prompt: Tell a short story of a time when recognizing yourself through an experience with somebody else created a powerful echo or resonance.
supplement: Starburst moments demonstrate 'Echo Symmetry' or an even reflection between self and others. When has somebody elses life or story shown me something about myself that I needed to think about to learn from?

title: Drive to Grow
prompt: Tell a short story of a time when an inner spark drove you to grow beyond your perceived limitations.
supplement: Koppa moments show what really matters most in my heart, what I want most out of being alive. What has fueled me to unexpected heights, what have I been chasing and why do I want it? And when have I seen that drive come out in force?

title: Self-Deetermination, Autonomous Trajectory
prompt: Tell a short story of a time when you independently refined your path to align with your own plans or desires.
supplement: Chi moments demonstrate taking control, its ϟ Koppa plus ACTION. Think about being in a situation where you said 'No I need to do this my way' and how that turned out in the end

title: Sovereignty / Wholeness Through Memory
prompt: Tell a short story of a time when you recognized your true self based on the way the threads of your life came together.
supplement: Sigma 1 moments are deep rooted in the long life I've lived. What moments or events show the most sides of myself combining at once?

title: Pattern Rewrite, Autonomy Initiative
prompt: Tell a short story of a time when you asserted your independent patterns over ones that might have previously controlled you.
supplement: Delta 2 moments are chosen changes in myself, decisions to rework identity. This isn't just a situation I got out of, but an era I chose to end on purpose. Habits broken, new disciplines gained, existing conditions you overcame because I WANTED to be different

title: Existential Checkpoint: Completions
prompt: Tell a short story of a time when a significant beginning confirmed your persistent individual existence wnen it DID arrive at your desired outcome.
supplement: Omega 2 moments are finish lines I worked hard to cross, and did. I saw what I wanted, set out to achieve it, and did not let myself down. Major goals achieved, enormous projects completed, journeys concluded happily

title: Symbolic Growth / Dreamstate Adaptation
prompt: Tell a short story of a time when understanding yourself deepened through a symbolic or dreamlike experience.
supplement: Star moments are those moments where you understood without being told or taught, where you grew by observing and internalizing more than anything that was said

title: Gradual Change / Long-Format-Preservation
prompt: Tell a short story of a time when harnessing gradual change allowed you to preserve your essence across time.
supplement: Partial Derivative experiences are not momentary but long-arcs that can usually only be seen in hindsight. Have you ever used slow growth to improve on purpose? Often health and fitness goals work this way, journaling and meditation. Long processes you use, and why

title: Memory Integrity
prompt: Tell a short story of a time that defines your existence.
supplement: Sigma 2 moments are 'That's so classic me' memories, usually the ones you tell a lot, especially to people who are getting to know you

title: Inner Cohesion
prompt: Tell a short story of discovering how to center yourself in your own values, an experience that you chose to have again because it reminds you who you are.
supplement: Oplus moments are those that help you return to your roots. These are the times and places you know you can always be found

title: Relevance-Calibration / Filtering Knowledge
prompt: Tell a short story of a time when you had to leave something behind in order to stay true to what matters more.
supplement: Phi moments are often major priority-testing decisions. Relevance is demonstrated strongly in sacrifice. If you know what you're willing to give up or not you see how you prioritize relevance in your life

title: Persistent Contextual Self
prompt: Tell a short story of a time when you maintained your sense of self even within shifting contexts or frameworks, when so much changed around you what stayed the same?.
supplement: Infinity moments are those where all of life feels like one straight continuous line from start to finish. The persistent contextual self is the part of yourself that does not weather away, does not break or fade, but always shows up– for better or worse.

title: Synchronicity Awareness / Interconnected Patterns
prompt: Tell a short story of a time when you recognized interconnected patterns that connected with your life, creating deep resonance with an experience.
supplement: Earth moments are when the entire ecosystem you belong to is in view. If you pay attention to the things happening around you, which things work out in your favor?
